pros: Overall I enjoy working here.  The staff here is amazing and so incredibly friendly.
cons: Management is not aware or interested in staff needs, input, complaints or any other concerns.  They are notorious for short staffing the floors to the point where it's not just a pain for the staff but it's down right UNSAFE for staff and patients.  The CEO, Steven Gordon is unrealistic and condescending and has no idea how to run a hospital.   His only interests are padding his paycheck and getting rid of any services that the hospital provides (or that are house on the campus but ARE NOT run by the hospital) that are not bringing in money and are the REAL non-profits.  He decided to get rid of the Walk-in clinic housed on the campus that is independent from the hospital, runs entirely on donations, fundraisers and volunteers.  Local doctors, nurses and dentists who volunteer their time and provide ESSENTIAL care to people in the community who may not have insurance or cannot pay for the ridiculous medical costs we have today.  They offered FREE health services, information and references and they would run a free dental day every month.  Because of STEVE GORDON these are now in jeopardy.
